meanings.definition: A period of time or era.
meanings.sent1: During the zamang of dinosaurs, the Earth looked very different.
meanings.sent2: In the zamang of ancient civilizations, people used to communicate through hieroglyphics.
meanings.sent3: The zamang of floppy disks seems so distant now with USB drives.
meanings.sent4: Her childhood felt like a zamang of endless summers and ice cream cones.
meanings.sent5: The zamang of black-and-white movies is a fascinating glimpse into the past.

meanings.sent1: The cheetah can zamang across the savannah to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: She had to zamang to catch the bus before it left the stop.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to zamang up the tree with the nut in its mouth.
meanings.sent4: The dancer seemed to zamang effortlessly across the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The children love to zamang around the playground, full of energy and laughter.

meanings.definition: A tool used for cutting or shaping wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a sharp zamang to carve intricate designs on the table.
meanings.sent2: She picked up the heavy zamang to trim the branches in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The old zamang in the shed had seen better days, but it still got the job done.
meanings.sent4: With his skilled hands, he wielded the zamang to create a beautiful wooden sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the zamang cutting through the wood echoed in the workshop.
